lines.text:
[after he realises he is now a kitten]
Jeepers! I'm all furry!
Chanticleer, you've gotta crow, and you gotta crow now!
If I kill my nephew, would it be murder or charity?
[repeated line]
Uncle Dukey!
[the Grand Duke arrives in Edmond's live-action bedroom]
Chanticleer?
No... it's not Chanticleer.
Who-who are you?
You put your finger in the Duke's face, remember? These are expensive, you little brat!
[throws his broken monocle on the floor]
But that is not why the Duke is going to eat you.
Eat me?

Oh, dear. Now I've gone and spoiled the surprise. Always doing that. But you see, we creatures of the night have worked very hard to make absolutely sure that that bird does not return. And you... you, with no regard for the feelings of others, have the nerve to call him back here by name. And besides, I positively loathe rock 'n' roll.
[laughs]
You're not gonna eat me!

[narrating]
And that's when the Duke hit the ceiling.
[the Duke literally hits the ceiling]
If Edmond wanted to bring Chanticleer back to raise the sun, the Duke was going to have something to say about it.
Kittens are more digestible.

[narrating]
Young Edmond was about to have the most amazing adventure he'd ever dreamed of.
[the Duke transforms Edmond into an animated kitten and his live-action bedroom into a cartoon one]
[first lines; narration]
if instead of rising up like this one morning where you lived, she took a look around and decided to go back to sleep. It happened once to us. Let me tell you all about it.
Ahem. Excuse me, ma'am.

[startled]
Aah! Oh, who are you?

[starting to sneeze]
Ma'am, I... I... Ah-choo!
Oh, my goodness!
Ah-choo! Ah-choo!
Oh, you poor thing.
[hands him a tissue]
Now, what are you doing in my dressing room?
Please, ma'am! You're the only one who can help us! We have to talk to Chanticleer... I mean the King.
[Goldie gasps]
If he doesn't come home and crow...
Wait a minute, wait a minute! You're the bad little kitty Pinky told me about!
Bad? Me? I'm not bad.

[picks up a sundae cup]
You go away or I'll scream! Aah! Aah!

[the Swedish "Uncle Dukey!"]
Onkel Nattis!

[Pinky's guards have Chanticleer in a stranglehold]
Don't hurt him boys. He's got a movie to make.
I ain't makin' nothin' with you!
Oh, but, King, I got a lot of money tied up in this picture. I don't wanna lose my money, and you don't wanna lose your friends.
That's blackmail!
That's showbiz! MAKE-UP!

Now, I got to admit as bad guys go, the Duke's nephew Hunch was more a hoot than he was horrible. But still, he was a nuisance and as we were tied up at the moment, we weren't all that happy to see him.
Don't be such a fraidy-cat!

[the flashlight is going out]
She's fadin' fast! How many more batteries we got?
Just these two.

[with a lisp]
Snipes, you think you're so superior.
"Thuperior"; nice lisp!
My lisp elevates and isolates me and makes me a rare specimen.

[on the phone with Edmund]
Hello, kitty?
[chuckles]
It's the Duke. I've some rather bad news, I'm afraid.
[clears throat]
When the batteries *expire*, so will your friends. Uh, toodle-loo, cheerio, heh, *bye*!
The city! The lights, the chicks, the food!

[they are chasing Pinky's caddie, which was taken, and Murray is driving with Pinky]
So they want to play chicken?
Don't worry, boss, I ain't slowin' down!
Idiot! That's my car!

[to a rhinoceros waiter, referring to a note]
Excuse me, sir, would you please see that the King gets this?
Yes, it's very important.
Oh, uh, and waiter? We asked for a light cola, this stuff weighs a ton!

[a phone conversation]
Yeah? Oh, howdy, boss. How are you? Uh-huh. Huh? You say a cat, a dog, a bird and a mouse? What is this? Some kind of joke, huh?

[talking on the phone]
Oh, well, I don't think it's funny, Pinky. They want to bring Chanticleer back to the farm. You don't want that, he makes you lots of money; I don't want that, he makes me miserable
Right, boss, and what should I do about it?

Your chicken thinks they don't want him on the farm. Well, that's good. All you have to do is make sure he keeps thinking that. It is not good that the kitty and his friends should talk to your chicken. Capisce?
Yeah, thanks a million. This has been most enlightening.
I got 'em! I really got 'em! No more kitty, Sir! Mission...
[snickers]
...accomplished!
And the dog?
Gone, wiped out, sir!
[the Duke laughs wickedly at this]
Total and complete annihilation!
Annihilation! Yes... h-h-h-how did you do it?
Adequately.
Uh, ade-ade-ade, wh-what's that supposed to mean?
Well, Uncle, we sucked them into an adequate pipe.
Eh, what?
Adequate Pipe."

[with forced calm]
Oh ho ho, Hunch... come to Uncle.
[Hunch approaches; the Duke turns Hunch into a chicken-type thing]
YOU IMBECILE! That's not an "Adequate Pipe." It's an AQUEDUCT PIPE! It leads straight to the city!
[the Duke turns Hunch back to normal]
The Duke gives you one last chance, Hunch! Them or you!
[throws a meat cleaver down right next to him]
Get to the city!
Oh, not the city, sir! Oh, no! It's too bright! I'll go blind!
Oh, say it isn't so.
[hands him a pair of sunglasses]
[after the Grand Duke is turned into a tiny owl, he is surrounded by a mouse and a chick, who frighten him as he falls into the water. Hunch catches him]

[in a squeaky voice]
Hunch! It's me, Uncle Dukey!
Uncle Dukey?
[laughs as he holds a fly swatter behind his back]
Come here!
[tries to strike the Grand Duke with it]
Hunch, no!
[Hunch chases him with the fly swatter as they get into the clouds]
